title: Sky Brown
shareText: We're learning about Sky Brown today, the inspiring young skateboarding prodigy and Olympic medalist. Dream big and skate through life! 🛹
details: Sky Brown is a British-Japanese professional skateboarder and surfer who became one of the youngest Olympians at the 2020 Summer Games, earning a bronze medal in skateboarding. She inspires others with her determination, skill, and passion for pursuing her dreams at a young age.

lessons.lesson: Follow your passion and never stop learning!
lessons.story: Sky Brown discovered her love for skateboarding at a young age and worked hard to become one of the best, never letting age limit her ambitions.
lessons.question: What passion would you like to pursue and improve in?
lessons.activity: Pick something you're passionate about and try a new challenge today to get better at it!

lessons.story: Sky faced challenges, including injuries, but she always stayed positive and continued to pursue her dreams.
lessons.question: Can you think of a time you overcame something tough?
lessons.activity: Try a physical challenge like a mini obstacle course and keep pushing forward no matter how tricky it gets!

lessons.lesson: Believe in yourself, even when others doubt you!
lessons.story: Sky's success shows that age doesn’t define what you can achieve. She believed in herself, even when others thought she was too young.
lessons.question: What’s something you believe in about yourself?
lessons.activity: Write down a positive affirmation about yourself and repeat it every day!

activities.title: Skateboard Moves
activities.description: Try out different skateboard tricks or pretend moves in the yard or living room. Show how Sky mastered them with practice!

activities.title: Skater Music
activities.description: Listen to skater music like 'Sk8er Boi' by Avril Lavigne and dance, skate, or move to the beat. Talk about how music can inspire confidence and energy while skating!

activities.title: Mini Skate Park
activities.description: Set up a mini skate park with ramps (or use objects to create obstacles) and let the child try to skate through it like Sky.

activities.title: Dream Skateboard Design
activities.description: Create your own dream skateboard by drawing your designs on a piece of paper or a toy skateboard.

activities.title: Skateboarding at Home
activities.description: If possible, practice some basic moves on a skateboard, or simulate skateboarding using a broomstick or toy skateboards.

activities.title: Sky's Victory Lap
activities.description: Re-enact Sky Brown’s victory lap after her Olympic medal, celebrating with high-fives and cheers!

activities.title: Skateboarding Trivia
activities.description: Ask fun questions about skateboarding and Sky Brown’s achievements—great for learning more about this sport.

activities.title: Skateboarding Journal
activities.description: Create a journal to track skateboarding tricks and progress, just like Sky does when preparing for competitions.

activities.title: Skater’s Pose
activities.description: Strike a cool skater pose, pretending you just landed an awesome trick. How does it feel to succeed?

activities.title: Balance Challenge
activities.description: Practice balancing on one foot or a balance board, just like a skater maintains control on their board.

activities.title: Skateboard Obstacle Race
activities.description: Set up an obstacle course with jumping over items, balancing on beams, or weaving through objects to challenge the child.

activities.title: Inspirational Skater Poster
activities.description: Create a poster of Sky Brown in action or an inspirational quote from her to hang up!

activities.title: Create Your Own Skateboard
activities.description: Use craft supplies to make a skateboard model from cardboard, paper, and other materials.

activities.title: Olympic Dreams
activities.description: Discuss the Olympics and the journey to competing, while the child creates a vision board of their Olympic dreams.

activities.title: Skateboard Dance
activities.description: Create a fun skateboard-inspired dance routine or movement sequence to mimic skating moves.

activities.title: Sky's Skater Outfit
activities.description: Design your own skater look with clothes and accessories to feel like a pro skateboarder!

activities.title: Go for Gold
activities.description: Talk about the importance of striving for the best and create a mock gold medal to celebrate personal achievements.

title: Beyoncé
shareText: Today, we celebrated the incredible Beyoncé! From singing and dancing to confidence-building activities, we embraced the power of being bold and unstoppable! 🎤✨
details: Beyoncé is a global superstar known for her powerhouse vocals, incredible performances, and inspiring confidence. She encourages people to be fearless, work hard, and believe in themselves. Her journey from a young girl in Houston to an international icon shows the power of dedication and self-expression.

lessons.story: Beyoncé worked hard and believed in her dreams, even when things were tough.
lessons.question: What’s something you’re really good at or want to get better at?
lessons.activity: Stand in front of a mirror, strike a power pose, and say something positive about yourself!

lessons.story: Beyoncé practiced singing and dancing for hours to become one of the best performers in the world.
lessons.question: Can you think of something you got better at by practicing?
lessons.activity: Let’s learn a short dance or sing a song together!

lessons.story: Beyoncé supports and inspires others, especially young girls, to follow their dreams.
lessons.question: Can you think of a way to cheer someone up or make them feel special today?
lessons.activity: Make a ‘You’re amazing!’ card or video message for a friend or family member!

activities.title: Beyoncé Dance Party
activities.description: Put on some of Beyoncé’s upbeat songs and have a dance-off! Let loose, have fun, and express yourself.

activities.title: DIY Microphone
activities.description: Make a pretend microphone using a toilet paper roll and aluminum foil so your child can feel like a star.

activities.title: Sasha Fierce Confidence Walk
activities.description: Encourage your child to walk like a superstar on an imaginary red carpet, practicing confidence and power poses.

activities.title: Sing Like a Star
activities.description: Pick a Beyoncé song and sing along using a hairbrush as a mic. Bonus points for dramatic performances!

activities.title: Formation Dance Routine
activities.description: Learn a simple dance routine inspired by Beyoncé’s iconic performances and create your own moves!

activities.title: Queen Bee Craft
activities.description: Make a bee-themed craft using yellow and black paper to celebrate Beyoncé’s 'Queen Bey' nickname.

activities.title: Glam Star Makeover
activities.description: Have fun with dress-up, sparkly accessories, and face paint to create a pop star look.

activities.title: Lyrics and Poetry Fun
activities.description: Write a fun song or short poem about confidence and being yourself, inspired by Beyoncé’s lyrics.

activities.title: Superstar Stage Time
activities.description: Set up a 'stage' with blankets and pillows, and let your child put on a show.

activities.title: Inspirational Poster Making
activities.description: Make a poster with empowering Beyoncé quotes like 'I’m not bossy, I’m the boss!'

activities.title: Star Power Meditation
activities.description: Do a short meditation session where you talk about believing in yourself and being confident, just like Beyoncé.

activities.title: Music Video Moment
activities.description: Record a short video of your child performing their favorite Beyoncé song and play it back for fun.

activities.title: Power Pose Photoshoot
activities.description: Strike strong, confident poses and take pictures to celebrate feeling empowered.

activities.title: Glitter Microphone Cupcakes
activities.description: Bake and decorate cupcakes with edible glitter to represent Beyoncé’s dazzling performances.

activities.title: All The Single Bubbles
activities.description: Blow bubbles while dancing to 'Single Ladies' and see who can pop the most!

activities.title: Superstar Storytime
activities.description: Read about Beyoncé’s journey and how she worked hard to achieve her dreams.

activities.title: Lemonade Stand Fun
activities.description: Make fresh lemonade together, inspired by Beyoncé’s 'Lemonade' album, and enjoy it in the sun.

activities.title: Dance Floor Freeze
activities.description: Play Beyoncé music and freeze in fun dance poses when the music stops.

activities.title: Queen’s Crown Craft
activities.description: Make a sparkly crown out of cardboard and decorate it with gems and glitter to celebrate being bold and confident.

title: Steve Jobs
shareText: We’re learning all about Steve Jobs today, the visionary who changed the world with Apple. Think different, and never stop creating! 🍏
details: Steve Jobs co-founded Apple, a company that revolutionized technology and became one of the most influential and valuable companies in the world. Through his vision and innovation, he changed the way we live, work, and communicate.

lessons.story: Steve Jobs loved coming up with new ideas and making things better.
lessons.question: Can you think of a way to improve something you use every day?
lessons.activity: Design your own cool invention—draw it and explain how it works!

lessons.lesson: Keep trying, even when things go wrong!
lessons.story: Steve had failures, but he never gave up. He kept working until he made something great.
lessons.question: Have you ever had to try again and again to get something right?
lessons.activity: Try building something (like a tall tower with blocks) and see how you can make it even better!

lessons.story: Steve Jobs loved technology and design, and he turned that passion into amazing inventions.
lessons.question: What’s something you really love to do?
lessons.activity: Spend time doing something you love today—whether it's drawing, building, or playing!

activities.title: Paper iPad
activities.description: Create a pretend iPad by cutting a rectangle from cardboard or paper and decorating it with app icons.

activities.title: Apple Print Art
activities.description: Cut an apple in half, dip it in paint, and use it to stamp colorful apple shapes on paper.

activities.title: Innovation Collage
activities.description: Cut out pictures of gadgets or creative ideas from magazines and glue them onto a poster board.

activities.title: DIY Apple Logo
activities.description: Draw and color your own version of the Apple logo. You can make it rainbow-colored like the original!

activities.title: Cardboard Computer
activities.description: Turn a cardboard box into a pretend computer. Add keys, a screen, and even a pretend mouse!

activities.title: Idea Lightbulb
activities.description: Craft a lightbulb using paper, glitter, and markers to represent great ideas.

activities.title: Inventor's Notebook
activities.description: Decorate a small notebook where your toddler can 'draw' inventions or ideas.

activities.title: DIY Headphones
activities.description: Make pretend headphones using pipe cleaners and paper circles. Decorate them to look techy!

activities.title: Gadget Stick Puppets
activities.description: Create stick puppets of gadgets like a phone, computer, or tablet using craft sticks and paper.

activities.title: Rainbow Apple Garland
activities.description: Cut out apple shapes from colored paper, decorate them, and string them together to make a garland.

activities.title: Apple Hunt
activities.description: Hide paper apples or toy apples around the house. Pretend they're hidden innovations and search for them together.

activities.title: Inventor Charades
activities.description: Take turns acting out an invention or tool while the other guesses what it is.

activities.title: Apple Stack Challenge
activities.description: Stack as many apples (real or toy) as you can without them falling!

activities.title: Tech Simon Says
activities.description: Play 'Simon Says' but with tech-inspired actions, like 'type on a keyboard' or 'swipe on a phone.'

activities.title: Memory Match
activities.description: Create cards with pictures of tech gadgets or logos (like an apple, a computer, etc.) and play a matching game.

activities.title: Code the Robot
activities.description: Pretend one of you is a robot and the other gives simple 'code' commands (like 'walk forward' or 'pick up toy').

activities.title: Build-a-Gadget Race
activities.description: Use building blocks or household items to build pretend gadgets. Race to see who can finish first.

activities.title: What's in the Box?
activities.description: Put a gadget or toy in a box. Let your toddler feel inside without looking and guess what it is.

activities.title: Apple Toss
activities.description: Set up buckets or baskets and toss paper apples or balls into them to score points.

activities.title: Design the Future
activities.description: Draw pictures of what you think gadgets will look like in the future, then guess which idea will 'win.'

title: Marie Curie
shareText: We’re learning all about Marie Curie today, the trailblazing scientist who changed the world with her discoveries. Stay curious and never stop exploring! 🔬✨
details: Marie Curie was a scientist who won two Nobel Prizes for her groundbreaking work in radioactivity.

lessons.story: Marie Curie loved to ask questions and learn new things every day.
lessons.question: What’s something you’re really curious about today?
lessons.activity: Pick one thing around the house and find out how it works!

lessons.story: Marie worked late into the night doing science experiments to help people.
lessons.question: Can you think of a time when you kept trying even when something was hard?
lessons.activity: Let’s do a small challenge (like stacking blocks) and see how we improve!

lessons.lesson: Help others with what you know!
lessons.story: Marie’s discoveries helped millions of people get better treatments.
lessons.question: What’s one way you can help someone today?
lessons.activity: Think of one thing you’re good at and teach it to a family member!

activities.title: DIY 'Glow in the Dark' Experiment
activities.description: Use glow-in-the-dark paint or stickers to explore how light interacts with different surfaces. Tie it to Marie Curie’s work on radium and luminescence (safely!).

activities.title: Scientist Dress-Up
activities.description: Create a lab coat and safety goggles from craft materials. Add a 'Marie Curie' name badge and role-play scientific experiments.

activities.title: Chemistry Potion Making
activities.description: Use kitchen ingredients like vinegar, baking soda, and food coloring to create 'bubbling potions.' Explain the concept of reactions.

activities.title: Marie Curie Storytime
activities.description: Read a child-friendly book or watch a short video about her life and achievements. Discuss her resilience and contributions to science.

activities.title: Build a 'Periodic Table' Puzzle
activities.description: Create a simplified version of the periodic table using colored paper or printable templates. Highlight the elements Marie Curie discovered (polonium and radium).

activities.title: Marie Curie Medal Craft
activities.description: Make a paper medal to celebrate her two Nobel Prizes. Decorate it with gold paper or glitter and write 'Marie Curie - Nobel Laureate.'

activities.title: Science Journal
activities.description: Create a mini 'lab journal' where your daughter can record her 'experiments' or draw pictures of things she learns about.

activities.title: Radiation Art
activities.description: Use chalk or watercolors to create a glowing art piece. You can frame it as 'inspired by Marie Curie’s discoveries.'

activities.title: Microscope Play
activities.description: If you have a toy microscope, examine everyday objects like leaves or fabrics. Discuss how scientists like Marie Curie studied things in great detail.

activities.title: Create a Timeline of Her Life
activities.description: Make a visual timeline of Marie Curie’s milestones using pictures, drawings, or simple descriptions. Incorporate fun facts to make it engaging.

activities.title: Element Hunt
activities.description: Hide cards with element names or symbols around the house, and have your toddler find them.

activities.title: Beaker Balance
activities.description: Use cups or small containers to represent beakers and stack them carefully without toppling them over.

activities.title: Periodic Table Puzzle
activities.description: Create a simple puzzle with element symbols for your child to piece together.

activities.title: Glow Tag
activities.description: Play tag in a dim room with glow sticks or glowing bracelets to represent Marie Curie's discoveries.

activities.title: Test Tube Relay
activities.description: Set up a relay race where your toddler moves water or colored beads between cups (pretend test tubes).

activities.title: Lab Assistant Match
activities.description: Mix cards with science tools (like beakers, goggles, and scales) and have your toddler match them to their uses.

activities.title: Crystal Formation Game
activities.description: Use blocks or toys to 'grow' crystals by building towers together and learning how crystals form.

activities.title: Science Charades
activities.description: Act out science-related actions (mixing chemicals, wearing goggles, using a microscope) and guess what they are.

activities.title: Radiation Shield Challenge
activities.description: Create an obstacle course where your toddler wears a pretend shield (like cardboard) to 'block radiation.'

activities.title: Discovery Freeze Dance
activities.description: Play music and dance like scientists celebrating a discovery. When the music stops, freeze in a science pose!

activities.title: Experiment at Home
activities.description: Perform a safe science experiment using common household items.

activities.title: Discover Something New
activities.description: Learn about an element on the periodic table and create a fun fact sheet.

activities.title: Glow-in-the-Dark Art
activities.description: Create glowing artwork using glow-in-the-dark paint or markers to represent Marie Curie's discoveries.

activities.title: Periodic Table Poster
activities.description: Make a mini periodic table using colored paper and stickers for each element.

activities.title: Beaker Painting
activities.description: Paint or draw beakers and test tubes, then add colorful 'liquids' using markers or glitter.

activities.title: Element Necklace
activities.description: Create a necklace with beads that represent elements, like blue for oxygen or green for radium.

activities.title: Radium-Themed Lantern
activities.description: Decorate a paper lantern with stars and glowing designs inspired by Marie Curie's work with radium.

activities.title: Lab Coat Design
activities.description: Make a pretend lab coat from an oversized shirt and decorate it with drawings of science tools.

activities.title: Science Medal
activities.description: Craft a medal using cardboard and foil to represent Marie Curie’s Nobel Prize achievements.

activities.title: Crystal Decorations
activities.description: Create paper or pipe cleaner crystals to represent her discoveries in chemistry.

activities.title: Inventor's Goggles
activities.description: Make pretend science goggles using craft foam or paper and wear them for pretend experiments.

activities.title: Radiation Shield Craft
activities.description: Design a pretend radiation shield using cardboard and paint, like what scientists use for protection.

title: Elon Musk
shareText: We’ve been learning all about Elon Musk today, the entrepreneur behind Tesla, SpaceX, and more. The future belongs to those who dare to build it! 🌍🚀
details: Elon Musk is an entrepreneur and inventor who helped create Tesla electric cars, SpaceX rockets, and many other innovative projects.

lessons.lesson: Dream big and aim for the stars!
lessons.story: Elon Musk wanted to explore space and make life on Mars possible. He started SpaceX to work toward that dream.
lessons.question: If you could invent something for the future, what would it be?
lessons.activity: Design your own rocket or spaceship—draw it and give it a cool name!

lessons.story: Elon’s rockets failed many times before they finally worked, but he kept trying and learning from mistakes.
lessons.question: Can you think of a time when you didn’t give up, even when something was hard?
lessons.activity: Do a tricky challenge (like balancing something or a small puzzle) and keep trying until you get it!

lessons.lesson: Think of ways to help the world!
lessons.story: Elon created electric cars with Tesla to help the planet by reducing pollution.
lessons.question: What’s one thing we can do today to help the Earth?
lessons.activity: Find one way to be kind to the planet—recycle, save energy, or plant something!

activities.title: Rocket Race
activities.description: Set up a race using paper rockets on strings. Blow or pull them along to see whose rocket 'launches' fastest.

activities.title: Tesla Parking Challenge
activities.description: Create a pretend parking lot for toy cars and guide them into 'charging stations' like Teslas.

activities.title: Mars Rover Hunt
activities.description: Hide small objects around the house and pretend to be Mars rovers searching for signs of 'life.'

activities.title: Astronaut Freeze Tag
activities.description: Play a game of tag where 'frozen' players have to strike an astronaut pose until unfrozen.

activities.title: Reusable Rocket Toss
activities.description: Use a soft ball or toy rocket and play catch, emphasizing that SpaceX rockets can land and be reused.

activities.title: AI Simon Says
activities.description: Play 'Simon Says' but pretend the commands come from an AI robot. Add a techy twist to the rules!

activities.title: Space Cargo Relay
activities.description: Set up a relay game where 'cargo' (toys or objects) must be transported from Earth to Mars using toy vehicles.

activities.title: Tunnel Explorer
activities.description: Crawl through pillow or blanket tunnels, inspired by The Boring Company's underground transport system.

activities.title: Solar Panel Puzzle
activities.description: Create a puzzle with pieces that represent a solar panel and assemble it to 'power' a pretend house.

activities.title: Mars Jump
activities.description: Pretend to be on Mars, where gravity is lower. Jump as high as you can and measure your 'astronaut jumps.'

activities.title: Rocket Craft
activities.description: Create a rocket using cardboard tubes, paper, and markers. Add wings and a nose cone for decoration.

activities.title: DIY Tesla Car
activities.description: Make a pretend Tesla car using a cardboard box. Decorate it with wheels, headlights, and a Tesla logo.

activities.title: Mars Landscape Diorama
activities.description: Build a mini Mars scene using a shoebox, red sand or paper, and small toy vehicles as rovers.

activities.title: Space Helmet
activities.description: Craft a space helmet using a paper bag or balloon and decorate it to look like a SpaceX astronaut's gear.

activities.title: Solar System Mobile
activities.description: Make a hanging mobile of planets, with Mars and Earth as the focus, using paper and string.

activities.title: Solar Panel Art
activities.description: Create a model of a solar panel with cardboard and foil to learn about renewable energy.

activities.title: Mars Rover Model
activities.description: Use recycled materials like bottle caps, cardboard, and straws to build a pretend Mars rover.

activities.title: Underground Tunnel Drawing
activities.description: Draw a cross-section of an underground tunnel inspired by The Boring Company's projects.

activities.title: Reusable Rocket Puzzle
activities.description: Design a rocket-shaped puzzle from cardboard that can be taken apart and reassembled.

activities.title: SpaceX Logo Design
activities.description: Draw and color your own version of the SpaceX logo, or create a new logo for a space company.

title: Rosa Parks
shareText: We’ve been learning all about Rosa Parks today, the brave woman who stood up for what was right by staying seated. Courage changes the world! 🚌✊
details: Rosa Parks was a civil rights activist who became famous for refusing to give up her seat on a segregated bus, sparking the Montgomery Bus Boycott and becoming a symbol of resistance to racial injustice.

lessons.story: Rosa Parks refused to give up her bus seat because she believed everyone should be treated equally.
lessons.question: Can you think of a time when you spoke up for yourself or someone else?
lessons.activity: Role-play standing up for what’s right in a kind and respectful way!

lessons.lesson: One person can make a big difference!
lessons.story: Rosa’s bravery inspired many people to fight for fairness and changed history.
lessons.question: What’s one small way you can make the world a better place today?
lessons.activity: Do a kind act, like helping someone or writing a nice note to a friend!

lessons.lesson: Stay strong, even when things are tough!
lessons.story: Even when people were unkind, Rosa stayed calm and stood by what she believed.
lessons.question: Can you think of a time when you stayed strong, even in a hard situation?
lessons.activity: Practice deep breaths and power poses to feel strong and confident!

activities.title: Bus Seat Challenge
activities.description: Reenact the historic moment by setting up two rows of chairs. Let the child 'sit in the seat' and practice standing up for what's right.

activities.title: Freedom March Relay
activities.description: Set up a short relay course where the child marches with a 'sign' promoting equality, symbolizing the Montgomery Bus Boycott.

activities.title: Civil Rights Tag
activities.description: Play a game of tag, where the child can 'escape' oppression by reaching a safe zone, representing the struggle for freedom.

activities.title: Sit-in Role Play
activities.description: Pretend to be part of a sit-in protest. Use plush toys or dolls to act out peaceful protests for equal rights.

activities.title: Equality Word Hunt
activities.description: Hide cards with words like 'equality,' 'justice,' and 'freedom' around the room. Have the child find them and discuss their meaning.

activities.title: History Timeline
activities.description: Create a simple timeline on the floor or wall and place pictures of Rosa Parks and key moments in the Civil Rights Movement. Walk through them.

activities.title: Rosa Parks Memory Match
activities.description: Create memory cards with images of key events and figures from the Civil Rights Movement. Turn them over and try to match pairs.

activities.title: Bus Stop Station
activities.description: Pretend to be passengers on a bus. One child can 'board' and sit while others act out different scenarios. Discuss fairness and respect.

activities.title: Peaceful Protest Game
activities.description: Role-play a peaceful protest by holding homemade signs or chanting positive, inclusive messages while walking in a circle.

activities.title: Equality Obstacle Course
activities.description: Set up an obstacle course that the child must navigate while considering how each step represents overcoming obstacles in the fight for equality.

activities.title: Make a Bus Sign
activities.description: Create a simple bus stop sign with the words 'Equal Rights' using markers and construction paper.

activities.title: Freedom Banner
activities.description: Craft a banner with the words 'Freedom and Equality' using fabric, paint, or markers to hang in the room.

activities.title: Sit-in Protest Poster
activities.description: Design a protest poster with positive, inclusive messages that represent Rosa Parks’ fight for justice.

activities.title: Peace Sign Necklace
activities.description: Make a necklace with beads and a peace symbol pendant, symbolizing Rosa Parks’ advocacy for peaceful change.

activities.title: Rosa Parks Portrait
activities.description: Create a simple, child-friendly portrait of Rosa Parks using colored pencils or paints.

activities.title: Equality Paper Dolls
activities.description: Create paper dolls that represent different races and cultures. Use them to teach about equality and acceptance.

activities.title: Civil Rights Quilt
activities.description: Design a small quilt using fabric squares, each with a symbol of equality or justice that relates to Rosa Parks' legacy.

activities.title: Freedom Flag Craft
activities.description: Create a flag with symbols representing freedom, like peace doves or the scales of justice, using fabric or construction paper.

activities.title: Bus Art Project
activities.description: Use cardboard or craft sticks to build a model of a bus. Decorate it with the message of equality.

activities.title: Handprint Equality Art
activities.description: Make handprints on paper and write messages of equality, justice, and fairness around them. This can symbolize the impact of collective voices.

title: Serena Williams
shareText: We’ve been learning all about Serena Williams today, the tennis legend who showed the world the power of hard work and resilience. Dream big and play strong! 🎾💪
details: Serena Williams is one of the greatest tennis players of all time, known not only for her athletic achievements but also for her advocacy for gender equality, mental health, and empowerment of women and girls.

lessons.lesson: Work hard to achieve your goals!
lessons.story: Serena practiced tennis for hours every day to become one of the greatest athletes in the world.
lessons.question: What’s something you want to get better at?
lessons.activity: Practice a fun skill (like bouncing a ball or balancing on one foot) and see how much you improve!

lessons.story: Serena faced challenges, but she always believed she could succeed and never gave up.
lessons.question: Can you think of a time when you kept trying, even when something was hard?
lessons.activity: Look in the mirror and say, ‘I am strong! I am brave! I can do anything!’

lessons.story: Serena encourages young girls to follow their dreams and helps others through charity work.
lessons.question: What’s one way you can encourage someone today?
lessons.activity: Make a ‘You can do it!’ card or video message for a friend or family member!

activities.title: Tennis Ball Toss
activities.description: Set up a target and have the child toss a tennis ball into it. Discuss how Serena practiced hard to perfect her serve and how determination leads to success.

activities.title: Tennis Match Role Play
activities.description: Pretend to play a tennis match, taking turns to serve and hit the ball back and forth. Talk about sportsmanship and fair play.

activities.title: Champion Relay Race
activities.description: Create a race course and time the child as they sprint, just like Serena running toward victory. Discuss perseverance and striving to do your best.

activities.title: Mentor Match
activities.description: Pair up and have a friendly competition where each person encourages the other, just like Serena has inspired others to chase their dreams.

activities.title: Victory Pose
activities.description: Teach the child how to strike a victory pose like Serena after winning a match. Discuss how celebrating small victories in life is important.

activities.title: Serve and Smash Game
activities.description: Set up an area for the child to practice their tennis serve, using a ball and an open space. Talk about how Serena mastered the serve to win big matches.

activities.title: Role Model Relay
activities.description: Create a relay race where the child passes a baton to symbolize the passing of strength, hope, and motivation from Serena to them.

activities.title: Equality Challenge
activities.description: Create a challenge where the child must overcome different obstacles, symbolizing the challenges Serena faced in sports and life due to gender and racial inequality.

activities.title: Tennis Equipment Scavenger Hunt
activities.description: Hide tennis-related items (like a ball, racket, or sneakers) around the room and have the child find them, learning about the tools Serena uses for her sport.

activities.title: Confidence Building Exercise
activities.description: Lead the child in a series of positive affirmations and exercises to boost their confidence, just like Serena has been a strong advocate for self-belief and mental health.

activities.title: Tennis Ball Art
activities.description: Paint or decorate a tennis ball to represent Serena’s journey and her achievements. You can write empowering messages around the ball.

activities.title: Tennis Racket Frame
activities.description: Create a picture frame shaped like a tennis racket, with a photo of the child or a drawing of Serena, to celebrate their own victories and dreams.

activities.title: Serena's Victory Poster
activities.description: Make a poster of Serena’s triumphs, featuring her iconic poses and moments, using magazines or colored markers.

activities.title: Tennis Shoe Design
activities.description: Design a pair of tennis shoes using paper or cardboard, decorating them with colorful patterns and messages of strength.

activities.title: Tennis Court Collage
activities.description: Create a collage of a tennis court, adding images of Serena Williams and tennis-related items to highlight her connection to the sport.

activities.title: Champion Trophy
activities.description: Craft a trophy from paper or clay, decorating it with gold paint and a label reading 'Champion,' just like Serena.

activities.title: Serena Williams Paper Doll
activities.description: Create a paper doll of Serena, dressing her in her tennis outfit and giving her a tennis racket, to represent strength and success.

activities.title: Inspiration Bracelet
activities.description: Make a bracelet with beads that spell out empowering words like 'strong,' 'brave,' or 'champion,' to symbolize the inspiration Serena provides.

activities.title: Victory Banner
activities.description: Create a banner with the words 'Victory' or 'Champion' to display in the room, celebrating the child’s own triumphs.

activities.title: Tennis Ball Keychain
activities.description: Make a simple tennis ball keychain using felt or fabric, decorating it with fun colors or glitter to remind the child of Serena's resilience.

title: Walt Disney
shareText: Today we’ve been learning all about Walt Disney, the dreamer who turned imagination into magic. If you can dream it, you can do it! ✨🎢🎨
details: Walt Disney was an American entrepreneur, animator, and film producer who co-founded The Walt Disney Company. He is best known for creating beloved characters like Mickey Mouse and for transforming the entertainment industry with his films, theme parks, and innovations in animation.

lessons.story: Walt Disney loved dreaming up magical stories and creating new worlds for people to enjoy.
lessons.question: If you could create your own magical world, what would it look like?
lessons.activity: Draw or build a pretend world filled with fun characters and places!

lessons.lesson: Keep going, even when things don’t work out!
lessons.story: Walt Disney had many setbacks, but he never gave up on his dreams.
lessons.question: Can you think of a time when you kept trying, even when something was tough?
lessons.activity: Try a small challenge (like a puzzle or stacking cups) and don’t give up until you complete it!

lessons.story: Walt wanted to bring happiness to others through his movies and theme parks.
lessons.question: What’s one way you can make someone smile today?
lessons.activity: Do something kind—tell a joke, draw a happy picture, or give someone a big hug!

activities.title: Character Creation Game
activities.description: Have the child invent their own character, giving it a name and unique traits, just like Walt Disney created Mickey Mouse.

activities.title: Magic Kingdom Relay
activities.description: Set up a relay race where each step represents building part of Disney’s magic: one stop could be 'creating a new character' and another could be 'drawing your idea.'

activities.title: Disneyland Adventure
activities.description: Pretend to visit a Disney theme park by creating a 'map' and exploring different themed areas like the Magic Kingdom, just like a fun day at Disneyland.

activities.title: Animation Action
activities.description: Have the child act out different scenes from Disney films, becoming characters like Simba, Elsa, or Peter Pan, and practicing the idea of storytelling.

activities.title: Dream Big Game
activities.description: Draw a 'dream board' and ask the child to fill it with things they want to achieve, just like Walt Disney followed his own big dreams to create Disney World.

activities.title: Storytelling Time
activities.description: Encourage the child to make up their own story, just like Walt Disney did, and act it out with toys or costumes.

activities.title: Disney Trivia Challenge
activities.description: Play a trivia game where the child answers simple questions about Disney characters, movies, or history to encourage learning and curiosity.

activities.title: Castle Building Contest
activities.description: Use blocks or craft materials to create a castle, just like the iconic Disney castles. Discuss how Walt Disney built his 'castle' of dreams with creativity and persistence.

activities.title: Magic Wand Hunt
activities.description: Hide 'magic wands' around the room and let the child find them, imagining they’re creating magical moments like Disney characters do.

activities.title: Disney Movie Marathon
activities.description: Watch short clips from Disney movies and pause to discuss the magic behind the stories, characters, and themes Walt Disney introduced to the world.

activities.title: Create Your Own Disney Character
activities.description: Draw and color a new Disney character, creating a unique design and backstory just like Walt Disney did with Mickey Mouse.

activities.title: Castle Craft
activities.description: Make a simple castle using cardboard, paper, and markers to represent the iconic Disney castles.

activities.title: Magic Wand
activities.description: Create a magic wand using a stick and decorative paper or foam, adding glitter or stars to make it magical.

activities.title: Mickey Mouse Ears Headband
activities.description: Make Mickey Mouse ears using a headband and black construction paper to create your own Disney-inspired accessory.

activities.title: Disney Princess Crown
activities.description: Design and decorate a crown fit for a Disney princess using paper, stickers, and gems.

activities.title: Animation Flipbook
activities.description: Create a simple flipbook to animate a short story, just like early animation films that led to Disney’s breakthrough in animation.

activities.title: Disney Character Masks
activities.description: Create masks of popular Disney characters like Mickey Mouse, Cinderella, or Simba using paper plates, markers, and elastic bands.

activities.title: Storybook Pages
activities.description: Make a storybook by drawing a picture and writing a short story on each page, encouraging the child to tell their own Disney-like stories.

activities.title: Mickey Mouse Ears Cookies
activities.description: Bake simple cookies and use icing or chocolate to decorate them into Mickey Mouse-shaped ears.

activities.title: Disneyland Ticket Craft
activities.description: Create a fun 'Disneyland ticket' using paper and markers, and talk about Walt Disney’s dream of creating a magical world for families.

title: Amelia Earhart
shareText: We're learning all about Amelia Earhart today, the first woman to fly across the Atlantic solo. Dream big, sky's the limit! ✈️
details: Amelia Earhart was an American aviation pioneer and the first female aviator to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean. She broke barriers for women in aviation and inspired many with her bravery, determination, and adventurous spirit.

lessons.lesson: Follow your dreams, no matter how big!
lessons.story: Amelia Earhart dreamed of flying and became the first woman to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean.
lessons.question: What’s a big dream you want to chase?
lessons.activity: Create a vision board with pictures or drawings of your dreams and goals!

lessons.story: Amelia faced many obstacles, but she was always brave and pushed through her fears.
lessons.question: Can you think of a time when you were brave, even when you were nervous?
lessons.activity: Do something new today—whether it's trying a new food, learning a new skill, or exploring somewhere new!

lessons.lesson: Learn from mistakes and keep going!
lessons.story: Amelia learned from every challenge she faced and never let mistakes stop her from reaching her goals.
lessons.question: Have you ever made a mistake and learned something important from it?
lessons.activity: Try a new activity (like building something with blocks) and think about how you can improve next time!

activities.title: Fly Like Amelia
activities.description: Pretend to be Amelia Earhart flying an airplane. Have the child use their arms as wings while moving around the room or outside.

activities.title: Aviation Obstacle Course
activities.description: Set up an obstacle course that represents different challenges an aviator might face. The child can ‘fly’ through the course, imagining navigating through the sky.

activities.title: Map Your Flight Plan
activities.description: Create a simple map with locations to ‘fly’ to. Let the child plan their route, just like Amelia Earhart did on her historic flights.

activities.title: Paper Airplanes
activities.description: Make paper airplanes and see how far they fly. Discuss how Amelia Earhart’s planes were carefully designed for long-distance flights.

activities.title: Amelia’s Adventure Race
activities.description: Create a race with challenges along the way. Each stop could represent a key moment in Amelia’s career, and the child can ‘fly’ from one to the next.

activities.title: Flying High
activities.description: Have the child jump like they are flying through the air, pretending to be Amelia on one of her adventurous flights.

activities.title: Aviation Trivia
activities.description: Play a trivia game about famous aviators and aviation history. Ask simple questions about Amelia’s accomplishments and aviation facts.

activities.title: Pilot Pose
activities.description: Teach the child to strike a ‘pilot’ pose, like Amelia, and practice walking confidently, symbolizing her courage in breaking new ground.

activities.title: Amelia’s Courageous Journey
activities.description: Act out a journey, where the child is an explorer traveling across different countries and continents, similar to Amelia’s aviation milestones.

activities.title: Dream Big Flight
activities.description: Ask the child to talk about their dreams and create an imaginary flight map to represent their journey, encouraging them to aim high just like Amelia Earhart.

activities.title: Paper Airplanes
activities.description: Make a variety of paper airplanes and race them, talking about how Amelia Earhart flew long distances in her aircraft.

activities.title: Pilot Hat
activities.description: Create a pilot hat using construction paper or fabric. Decorate it with stars or an aviator’s emblem to represent Amelia’s iconic look.

activities.title: Amelia’s Airplane Model
activities.description: Build a simple model airplane using craft materials like cardboard, paper, and glue to represent the planes Amelia Earhart flew.

activities.title: Flight Logbook
activities.description: Create a small flight logbook where the child can draw or write about their imaginary flights, just like Amelia kept records of her journeys.

activities.title: Aviation Badge
activities.description: Make a badge with wings or an airplane symbol using foam or paper, representing the badge of honor Amelia earned as a pioneering aviator.

activities.title: Travel Journal
activities.description: Design a travel journal with a cover that features an airplane or globe, where the child can document their adventures and dreams of flying.

activities.title: Map of the World
activities.description: Create a world map and mark some of the locations Amelia Earhart visited or flew over, helping the child understand her global impact.

activities.title: Paper Plane Mobile
activities.description: Make a mobile using small paper airplanes, hanging them to represent Amelia’s flights and the journey of discovery.

activities.title: Amelia’s Flight Path Poster
activities.description: Create a poster showing Amelia’s famous flight path across the Atlantic, using lines and dots to represent her journey.

activities.title: Aviator Sunglasses Craft
activities.description: Make a pair of aviator-style sunglasses using cardboard and foil or paper, symbolizing the classic look of a pilot.

title: Henry Ford
shareText: Today, we’ve been learning all about Henry Ford, the pioneer who revolutionized transportation. With innovation and determination, anything is possible! 🚗⚙️
details: Henry Ford was an American industrialist who revolutionized the automobile industry by introducing the assembly line for mass production, making cars more affordable and accessible to the general public. His innovations helped shape modern industry and the way we work today.

lessons.story: Henry Ford invented the assembly line to make cars faster and more affordable for everyone.
lessons.question: What’s something you think could be made better with a new idea?
lessons.activity: Design your own invention that could make life easier or more fun!

lessons.lesson: Hard work and teamwork lead to success!
lessons.story: Henry Ford worked with a team of people to create the first mass-produced car, the Model T.
lessons.question: Can you think of a time when you worked with others to achieve something great?
lessons.activity: Work together to build something (like a tower or a puzzle) and see what you can create as a team!

lessons.story: Henry Ford always looked for ways to improve his products, even when things were already going well.
lessons.question: What’s something you’ve learned recently that you want to get even better at?
lessons.activity: Pick something you’re interested in and learn more about it by reading or asking questions!

activities.title: Assembly Line Challenge
activities.description: Set up an assembly line with different tasks and have the child complete each step in the process, simulating how cars were made faster and more efficiently at Ford's factories.

activities.title: Build a Car
activities.description: Use building blocks or cardboard to create a car. Discuss how Henry Ford transformed car production with his mass production techniques.

activities.title: Design Your Dream Car
activities.description: Let the child design their own dream car using markers, crayons, and paper. Talk about how Henry Ford made cars more affordable for everyone.

activities.title: Ford Factory Tour
activities.description: Pretend you are touring a Ford factory. The child can ‘work’ on different parts of the car as part of the ‘assembly line,’ learning about how Ford’s system changed the production process.

activities.title: Automobile Race
activities.description: Create a simple race with toy cars or self-made cardboard cars. Discuss the importance of Ford’s work in making cars faster and more reliable.

activities.title: Ford’s Legacy Game
activities.description: Play a trivia game about Henry Ford's life and inventions, including questions about his innovations and how they changed the world.

activities.title: Parts of a Car
activities.description: Use simple drawings or cutouts to teach the child about the different parts of a car, explaining how Henry Ford’s mass production made car parts more standardized.

activities.title: Factory Worker Role Play
activities.description: Role-play being factory workers during Henry Ford’s era. The child can pretend to work on different steps of the assembly line.

activities.title: Teamwork Challenge
activities.description: Create a group task where the child and others must work together to build something (like a car model) in stages, learning about teamwork, a core principle at Ford’s factories.

activities.title: Innovation Discussion
activities.description: Talk about inventions that have changed the world, and ask the child how they would invent something that makes the world better, just like Ford did with the automobile.

activities.title: Car Design Drawing
activities.description: Draw a car together and decorate it with fun colors and patterns. Discuss how Henry Ford made cars affordable and how each car is different.

activities.title: Build a Cardboard Car
activities.description: Create a simple car using cardboard and markers. Talk about how Ford’s assembly line helped make cars more affordable and accessible to everyone.

activities.title: Assembly Line Poster
activities.description: Create a poster showing a simple assembly line and how each worker adds a part to a product, explaining how Ford revolutionized production.

activities.title: Car Wheels Craft
activities.description: Make wheels using paper plates and decorate them to represent the wheels of a car, explaining how the design of the Ford car influenced automobile development.

activities.title: Model T Car Craft
activities.description: Create a paper or clay model of the first Ford Model T, illustrating the classic car that changed the automotive world.

activities.title: Factory Blueprint
activities.description: Design a simple blueprint of a factory or assembly line using paper and markers, showing how Ford organized mass production.

activities.title: Paper Car Craft
activities.description: Cut out shapes of car parts (wheels, windows, doors) and assemble them into a simple paper car. Discuss how Ford’s innovation led to car mass production.

activities.title: Ford’s Factory Mural
activities.description: Create a mural of a Ford factory and its workers using markers, crayons, and cutouts, illustrating the hustle and bustle of early 20th-century manufacturing.

activities.title: Car Part Puzzle
activities.description: Create a puzzle by cutting out shapes that represent different car parts (engine, wheels, doors) and let the child put the puzzle together, learning about the mechanics of cars.

activities.title: Mini Car Model
activities.description: Use clay or modeling dough to create a miniature car, showing how cars were built and how Ford's methods made them more affordable and available to everyone.

title: Simone Biles
shareText: We’ve been learning all about Simone Biles today, the gymnast who defied limits and inspired the world with her strength and grace. Reach for the stars and keep pushing forward! 🤸‍♀️🌟
details: Simone Biles is a world-renowned gymnast and the most decorated in history. Known for her powerful performances and unwavering determination, she has inspired millions with her achievements and resilience, both on and off the mat.

lessons.story: Simone Biles believed in herself and her incredible talents, which helped her become one of the greatest gymnasts in history.
lessons.question: What’s something you’re really good at?
lessons.activity: Practice a skill you enjoy, whether it’s jumping, balancing, or a fun dance move, and see how much better you can get!

lessons.story: Simone trains hard every day to perfect her routines and achieve her dreams.
lessons.question: Can you think of a time when you worked hard to achieve something important?
lessons.activity: Set a small challenge for yourself (like balancing on one foot or drawing something new) and practice until you get it just right!

lessons.story: Simone supports her fellow gymnasts and celebrates their successes, showing the importance of teamwork and encouragement.
lessons.question: What’s one way you can support a friend today?
lessons.activity: Make a ‘cheer-up’ card or tell a friend something kind and encouraging!

activities.title: DIY Gymnastics Routine
activities.description: Create a simple gymnastics routine with cartwheels, somersaults, and stretches. Add music to make it fun!

activities.title: Obstacle Course
activities.description: Set up a course with cushions, hula hoops, and tape for balance beams to practice agility and coordination.

activities.title: Medal Crafting
activities.description: Make 'gold medals' using cardboard, foil, and ribbon. Present them at the end of the day.

activities.title: Balance Beam Walk
activities.description: Use a long piece of tape on the floor as a balance beam and practice walking across with arms outstretched.

activities.title: Strength Challenge
activities.description: Do exercises Simone might do, like planks, push-ups, or holding poses like a 'gymnast’s T.'

activities.title: Gymnastics Coloring Time
activities.description: Print out Simone Biles-themed coloring sheets or create your own drawings.

activities.title: Storytime with Simone
activities.description: Read or watch kid-friendly interviews, books, or videos about Simone’s journey to inspire your child.

activities.title: Ribbon Dancing
activities.description: Attach ribbons to sticks and dance around, mimicking rhythmic gymnastics.

activities.title: Team Spirit Craft
activities.description: Design matching 'team uniforms' with T-shirts and markers, drawing inspiration from Simone’s sparkly leotards.

activities.title: Mini Gymnastics Show
activities.description: Put on a performance at the end of the day with your child showcasing their new 'gymnastics skills.'

activities.title: Simone’s Trivia Quiz
activities.description: Create a fun quiz with facts about Simone’s life, achievements, and gymnastics.

activities.title: Gold Medal Cookie Decorating
activities.description: Bake round cookies and decorate them with gold icing to resemble medals.

activities.title: Gymnastics Bingo
activities.description: Make a bingo card with actions like 'cartwheel,' 'handstand,' and 'stretch.' Check off each one as you complete it.

activities.title: Simon Says Gymnastics
activities.description: Play a 'Simone Says' version where commands involve gymnastics poses and moves.

activities.title: DIY Gym Bag
activities.description: Decorate a small tote bag to resemble a gymnast’s bag for holding 'equipment' or costumes.

activities.title: Inspirational Poster Making
activities.description: Create a poster with Simone Biles’ famous quotes, like 'I’d rather regret the risks that didn’t work out than the chances I didn’t take.'

activities.title: Hula Hoop Tricks
activities.description: Practice spins, tosses, and jumps with a hula hoop as part of a gymnastics-inspired session.

activities.title: Rhythm and Beats
activities.description: Choreograph a short routine using claps, stomps, or simple percussion instruments.

activities.title: Video Replay Fun
activities.description: Record your child doing their gymnastics moves, then watch and 'commentate' like a professional gymnastics competition.

activities.title: Confidence Crown
activities.description: Make a paper crown and write words that describe Simone, like 'strong,' 'brave,' and 'determined.' Add your child’s name to show they’re a champion too!

title: Frida Kahlo
shareText: We’ve been learning all about Frida Kahlo today, the artist who turned pain into powerful art. Embrace your uniqueness and let your creativity flow! 🎨🌸
details: Frida Kahlo was a Mexican artist known for her bold and colourful self-portraits that expressed her emotions, culture, and life story. Despite facing great challenges, including illness and injury, she turned her pain into beautiful, meaningful art. Frida is celebrated for her strength, creativity, and love for her heritage.

lessons.story: Frida Kahlo celebrated her unique style and never tried to change herself to fit in.
lessons.question: What makes you special and different?
lessons.activity: Create a self-portrait that shows your unique qualities, like your favorite colors or things you love!

lessons.story: Frida used painting to express her emotions and share her story with the world.
lessons.question: What’s something you feel really strongly about?
lessons.activity: Use colors and shapes to paint or draw how you feel about something important to you!

lessons.story: Frida faced many physical and personal challenges, but she turned them into powerful works of art that inspired others.
lessons.question: Have you ever faced something hard and found strength from it?
lessons.activity: Create a piece of art or a story that shows how you’ve been strong through tough times!

activities.title: Paint Your Own Portrait
activities.description: Provide paints and paper for your child to create their own self-portrait, just like Frida Kahlo. Talk about how Frida used her paintings to tell stories about her life and feelings.

activities.title: Flower Crown Craft
activities.description: Make a flower crown using paper, pipe cleaners, or real flowers to mimic Frida’s iconic style. Discuss how Frida celebrated her Mexican heritage through her clothing and accessories.

activities.title: Mexican Culture Exploration
activities.description: Learn about Mexican traditions and culture by cooking a simple Mexican dish together or listening to traditional Mexican music.

activities.title: Storytime: Frida's Life
activities.description: Tell a simplified story of Frida Kahlo’s life, focusing on her strength, creativity, and love of painting. Highlight how she turned challenges into art.

activities.title: Mirror Drawing Challenge
activities.description: Set up a mirror and let your child draw themselves while looking into it, just as Frida often did. Encourage them to add fun colours and symbols to represent their personality.

activities.title: Symbolic Art
activities.description: Talk about how Frida used symbols in her paintings. Let your child create their own art piece using symbols that represent their feelings or favourite things.

activities.title: Create a Mini Easel
activities.description: Make a tiny easel using popsicle sticks and glue. Place a small piece of paper or card on it for your child to paint or draw on.

activities.title: Frida's Wardrobe Play
activities.description: Dress up like Frida by wearing bright colours, shawls, or floral prints. Let your child add accessories like earrings or scarves to feel artistic and inspired.

activities.title: Art Gallery Walk
activities.description: Print or display pictures of Frida Kahlo’s artwork and have an ‘art gallery’ walk. Talk about the colours, expressions, and symbols in her paintings.

activities.title: Draw Frida’s Pets
activities.description: Frida loved animals like monkeys, parrots, and dogs. Let your child draw or paint one of her pets and talk about how they appeared in her art.

activities.title: Design a Frida Bookmark
activities.description: Help your child design a bookmark inspired by Frida’s art, using bright colours, flowers, and patterns.

activities.title: Emotion Art
activities.description: Ask your child to draw or paint how they feel today. Explain how Frida painted her emotions to express herself when words weren’t enough.

activities.title: Mexican Folk Art Collage
activities.description: Make a collage using cut-out paper in bold patterns and shapes inspired by Mexican folk art, like the designs Frida loved.

activities.title: Decorate a Frame
activities.description: Frida often painted on unique frames. Provide a plain photo frame and let your child decorate it with paints, glitter, and small flowers.

activities.title: Cactus Craft
activities.description: Create a paper or clay cactus, a plant often seen in Mexican art and culture. Talk about how Frida’s surroundings inspired her work.

activities.title: Frida Quote Reflection
activities.description: Share a simple Frida Kahlo quote like 'Feet, what do I need you for when I have wings to fly?' and talk about what it means. Let your child share what inspires them.

activities.title: Create a Rainbow Palette
activities.description: Explore colours by mixing paints to create Frida’s vibrant palette. Let your child paint with their favourite colours.

activities.title: Make a Postcard for Frida
activities.description: Ask your child to design a postcard for Frida with drawings and a short message, imagining what they would say if they could meet her.

activities.title: Paper Mural Art
activities.description: Create a large collaborative artwork by taping together sheets of paper and letting your child draw big, bold images inspired by Frida’s art.

activities.title: Story Collage
activities.description: Provide old magazines, paper, and glue for your child to make a collage that tells a story, just like Frida told stories with her paintings.
